item.title: China’s Xi Places His Top General Under Investigation as Military Purges Heat Up
item.description: Gen. Zhang Youxia is the most senior active member of the military hierarchy to face dismissal since the fallout of the 1989 Tiananmen Square protests.

item.title: China Built a Vast Oil Stake in Venezuela. Now It Risks Getting Muscled Out.
item.description: Beijing’s moves bought it sway in Venezuela—all of it now subject to the Trump administration’s preferences in the wake of Maduro’s ouster.

item.title: The Chinese Spy Machine Infiltrating Taiwan’s Military
item.description: Beijing’s rapidly advancing spying operations have seen agents penetrate the island’s armed forces, enticing personnel to pledge allegiance to China.

item.title: China Imports to Help Lower U.K. Inflation to Target, BOE’s Taylor Says
item.description: The annual rate of inflation is likely to fall to the Bank of England’s 2% target by the middle of this year, aided by cheap imports from China, the rate-setter said.

item.title: Pentagon’s New Defense Strategy Strikes Conciliatory Tone on China
item.description: The blueprint says the U.S. will focus attention on the Western Hemisphere while reducing its military role in Europe, South Korea and the Middle East.

item.title: Trump Administration Pushes Out Key Officials Focused on China Tech Threat
item.description: The departing staffers worked for a Commerce Department office charged with protecting the U.S. from Chinese technological advances.

item.title: China Signals Tolerance for Stronger Yuan
item.description: The People’s Bank of China set the strongest reference rate for the currency in almost three years.

item.title: China Sees a Chance to Lure Jaded U.S. Allies
item.description: Beijing has seized upon the disarray within the trans-Atlantic alliance and is trying to entice U.S. allies with the promise of reliable trade partnerships.

item.title: China Vanke Wins Reprieve on Overdue Bond Payments
item.description: The developer’s bondholders had previously rejected proposals to restructure payment on the bond.

item.title: South Africa Risks Angering Trump by Hosting Navies of Iran, Russia, China
item.description: The military exercises come at a time of already strained relations with the U.S.

item.title: India Is on a Himalayan Building Spree to Prepare for a Clash With China
item.description: A deadly standoff jolted India to stitch together a huge network of roads, tunnels and landing strips needed to move soldiers and supplies to the mountainous border region.

item.title: Chinese EVs Blow Past Tesla and Tariffs En Route to Global Reign
item.description: The U.S., the European Union and Mexico are trying to quash accelerating demand for China’s hottest electric vehicles.
